it.hackcaffebabe.monitoring.logger

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.hackcaffebabe.monitoring.logger.Logger

  • public final class Logger
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple singleton class to instance a logger. Use the code below to retrieve the same logger object into the project. 
    
 Logger g = Logger.getInstance();
 g.write( Tag.ERROR, "asD" ); //to write a log message on the print stream
    And to set the logger in Production mode: 
    
 g.disableTag(Tag.DEBUG);
 //to set the stream on the log file
 g.setPrintStream( new PrintStream( new File( "~/a.log" ) );

      • getInstance

        public static Logger getInstance()
        Returns the instance of logger object.
        Returns:

      • write

        public void write(Tag tag,
                  java.lang.Object obj)
        Write a specific log message with tag Tag
        Parameters:
        tag - Tag the tag of log message.
        obj - String the message of log.

      • disableTag

        public void disableTag(Tag t)
        This method disable specific tag on write() method.
        Parameters:
        t - Tag the tag to disable. Pass null to clear all disable tag.

      • showCaller

        public void showCaller(boolean b)
        This method show the caller of write method on log.
        Parameters:
        b - boolean true show the caller of write method, otherwise false.

      • setPrintStream

        public void setPrintStream(java.io.PrintStream printStream)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the default print stream on witch will be write the log message.
        Parameters:
        printStream - PrintStream the stream that will be write the log message.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if printStream is null.

      • getPrintStream

        public java.io.PrintStream getPrintStream()
